Dear Sheffield City Council,
Agents, working on behalf of Sheffield City Council have been attempting to conduct "litter enforcement" on railway property in the vicinity of Sheffield railway station and on land that is owned and regulated by the railway authority, and within the defined boundary that confirms it is relevant land for the purposes of railway byelaws.
Accordingly, the Railway Byelaws apply (made under section 219 of the Transport Act 2000 by the Strategic Rail Authority (the “authority”) and confirmed under schedule 20 of the Transport Act 2000 by the Secretary of State for Transport).
In accordance with Railway Byelaw 7(2) it is an offence to carry on a trade, or attempt to distribute anything etc - without prior written permission from a specified operator.
Therefore, please provide a copy of your written permission to operate on railway premises in accordance with Byelaw 7(2).
Please confirm whether or not staff working for, or on behalf of, Sheffield City Council are authorised persons in accordance with Byelaw 25. In the highly unlikely event that you have this permission, please provide further information, including any correspondence or warrant confirming the authorised person status.
Finally, please confirm how many litter/waste enforcement penalties/notices  in the previous 12 months have been issued where the location suggests or specifies it was issued on or near Sheffield railway station.
Yours faithfully,
Duncan

Dear Duncan Lewis,
Thank you for your request for information relating to litter enforcement
which we received on 28/06/2024.
Please find Sheffield City Council’s response to your request set out
below:
Authorised litter enforcement officers working for Sheffield City Council,
do carry out litter patrols on land in front of Sheffield Train Station,
this land forms part of the Highway and is maintained by Sheffield City
Council. Under the littering legislation, The Environmental Protection Act
1990, it is an offence to drop litter on any land which is open to the air
to which the public have access.
We can confirm that in the last 12 months 841 littering Fixed Penalty
Notices for littering have been issued in the vicinity of Sheffield Train
Station.
If you have any queries about this response, please do not hesitate to
contact us.
The information provided in this response is available for re-use under
the terms of the Open Government Licence v3.0. The terms of the OGL can be
found [1]here. When re-using the information, Sheffield City Council
requires you to include the following attribution statement: “Contains
public sector information obtained from Sheffield City Council and
licensed under the Open Government Licence v3.0.”
If you are unhappy with the response you have received in relation to your
request, you are entitled to have this reviewed. You can ask for an
internal review by replying to this email. Internal review requests should
be submitted within 40 working days from the date of this response.
If you remain dissatisfied with the outcome of your internal review, you
can contact the Information Commissioner’s Office. Please see
[2]
https://ico.org.uk/make-a-complaint/offi...
for further details.
Kind Regards,
Sheffield City Council

Sheffield, S1 1UJ
